maml:description.maml:para: Creates a SQL Management Object.

Creates a SQL Management Object against the specified SQL server/instance using either current session credentials (Kerberos/NTLM) or specified credentials for SQL Authentication. The object is the typical .NET object that you normally would get if ran through the connection process normally. Be cautious when enumerating this object as it can put quite a load on the SQL server and consume quite a bit of memory in the PowerShell session.
The Fully-Qualified Domain Name or NetBIOS name of the server to connect to.
The name of the SQL Instance on the specified SQL server to connect to.
The Fully-Qualified Domain Name or NetBIOS name of the server to connect to.
The name of the SQL Instance on the specified SQL server to connect to.

maml:alert.maml:para: Be cautious when enumerating this object as it can put quite a load on the SQL server and consume quite a bit of memory in the PowerShell session.

maml:description.maml:para: Stores an SMO for use in the current PowerShell session.
Sets the session's context so all other SMO cmdlets reference the given SMO for the duration of the PowerShell session.
The SQL Management Object to be set as the session's context. Use the 'New-SMO' cmdlet to generate.
Specifies the cmdlet to overwrite the existing SMO session context if one exists. Without this, if the session's context had been set previously, the cmdlet will fail.
The SQL Management Object to be set as the session's context. Use the 'New-SMO' cmdlet to generate.
Specifies the cmdlet to overwrite the existing SMO session context if one exists. Without this, if the session's context had been set previously, the cmdlet will fail.
Disconnects from the current SMO context.
Disconnects and disposes of the SQL Management Object in the PowerShell session's context, after which it runs the garbage collector.
Displays the SMO context information.
Returns details about the current session's SMO.
A read-only display of the current context's connection.
Gets one or more Configuration Properties from the current SMO context.
Retrieves one, more, or all of the configuration properties within the given SQL server/instance, and displays their values.
The name(s) of the desired configuration properties to display.
When specified without providing property values, it will also return configuration properties that do not have values.
The name(s) of the desired configuration properties to display.
When specified without providing property values, it will also return configuration properties that do not have values.
Displays the name, config value, and whether the running value matches the config value.
Gets one or more SQL databases from the current context's connection.
Retrieves information about the specified SQL databases from the SMO context. The list of databases to query will be pulled dynamically.
The name of the database(s) to retrieve information for.
Only displays the database name in the resulting output.
The name of the database(s) to retrieve information for.
Only displays the database name in the resulting output.
Gets the SQL tables for a given database.
Details table information from one or more databases.
Specifies the name(s) of specific SQL tables to retrieve. If this parameter is not specified, all tables will be returned.
Specifies the SQL database to retrieve the tables from.
Specifies to return only the names of all database tables.
Specifies the SQL database to retrieve the tables from.
Specifies the SQL database to retrieve the tables from.
Specifies the name(s) of specific SQL tables to retrieve. If this parameter is not specified, all tables will be returned.
Specifies to return only the names of all database tables.
Gets the SQL columns for a given table.
Details column information from one or more tables in a database.
The specific name(s) of (a) column(s) to retrieve.
Specifies the SQL table from which the columns' information is retrieved.
Specifies to return only the names of a given table's columns.
Specifies the SQL table from which the columns' information is retrieved.
Specifies the SQL table from which the columns' information is retrieved.
The specific name(s) of (a) column(s) to retrieve.
Specifies to return only the names of a given table's columns.

command:example.maml:title: Get all columns
command:example.dev:code: C:\PS> $tbl = Get-SMODatabase master | Get-SMOTable -Name "spt_monitor" C:\PS> Get-SMOColumn -Table $tbl

command:example.maml:title: Get all columns from all tables from all databases

dev:remarks.maml:para: This could be extremely resource intensive.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets one or more Configuration Properties from the current SMO context with new values.
Alters one or more of configuration properties within the given SQL server/instance with different values.
The name of the desired configuration property to alter.
Specifies the new value to be given to the specified configuration properties.
Specifies the new value to be given to the specified configuration properties.
The SMOProperty values that are to be altered with new values.
The name of the desired configuration property to alter.
The SMOProperty values that are to be altered with new values.
Specifies the new value to be given to the specified configuration properties.

maml:alert.maml:para: This is an 'INSTANT' change on the SQL server's configuration. Be cautious when adjusting values.

maml:introduction.maml:para: Change the specified property to a different value

maml:description.maml:para: Displays the memory limits.
Shows what the current SQL server/instance's memory limit in the given unit of measurement.
Specifies the unit of bytes to display the results in.
Specifies the unit of bytes to display the results in.
Akters the memory limits.
Changes what the current SQL server/instance's memory limit is in the given unit of measurement.
Specifies a new value for the minimum SQL memory limit.
Specifies a new value for the maximum SQL memory limit.
Specifies the unit of bytes to set the given values in.
Specifies a new value for the minimum SQL memory limit.
Specifies a new value for the maximum SQL memory limit.
Specifies the unit of bytes to set the given values in.
